comments.commentBody: Hey William Rhoden!  I gotcha  metrasexual quartaback right heah!
What was that Rhoden guy talking about? Retrograde! Retrograde! ala Jim Mora.

The great Dandy Don would've been singing "Turn Out the Lights, the Party's Over" about five minutes into this one. The whole league should be singing it as well- the only question left is, who gets to lose the Super Bowl to the Patriots? They are looking like an all-time team just hitting it's stride. It also helps to have Brady- far and away the best player in NFL history. Your only hope is to get a pass rush on him like the Giants did in the Super Bowl a few years ago- but this is difficult as he gets rid of the ball so quickly and has one of the all time best pass blocking offensive lines (been that for years). They don't committ penalties either- and totally out-hit the Jets from the get go. The Pats only worry is Sourpuss Bill's penchant for running up the score- you keep wondering if he's going to pay by getting Brady injured by keeping him in the game in one of their patented 40 point blowouts. Oh yeah, 200 plus passes without a pick and they never fumble either. Did I miss anything?
See you in the post season Jets.
Pats fan here, wishing every opposing coach would bait our team and coach the way RR did this week. The closest RR gets to a ring is shaking the hand that wears 3 of them.

Another company who will take the money they might have to pay out of you and me somehow, this is a huge suit. What amazes me is that the Supreme court is actually taking it, they dont' take any cases pertaining to Obama or any US Citizens or their  Lawyers because they say we have no standing but almost 4000 workers from walmart do? I thought the Supreme court was on an extended vacation. Nice to see them doing something for someone, anyone.

Patriots not only held the swords high, but also clenched to their shields. Brady-Woodhead-Welker were a great trifecta in the game as they aced the execution of the planning. The Patriots took advantage of those little mistakes that led to defeat the Jets on this cold monday night.
Sanchez does what he does best - choke.

I like Alderson's calm, methodical approach. From the comments I read on some of the blogs, too many Mets' fans are impatient to make deals. The impulsive dealswill just dig our hole deeper. 2011 is our year to sit tight and wait for the burdensome contracts on the roster to run expire. There is no single (or even two) player(s) available that will make the Mets a contender in 2011.
My advice to Mets fans is to enjoy Dickey, Reyes and Wright while they're still around.

DHM (8:37 p.m),
I spent September through November in Massachusetts . Saw the comedian Bob Marley (of Maine) the day after the Yanks were bounced by Texas. He opened his show (in Boston) by saying " the Red Sox season "wasn't a total loss because at least the Yankees didn't make it to the World Series", and therefore, it was "a great day". It drew a predictably huge round of applause.

I don't think Jerry Seinfeld ever needed to include the Red Sox' failures in his act.

Yankees fans don't care nearly as much about the Red Sox losses as they do about the Yankees victories. We don't live to see you guys suffer. Really. And making an observation of such does not prove the opposite.

If you look closely at the deal, it is the Republicans who have most compromised their basic principles, not Obama.  Obama wanted more stimulus spending and couldn't get it through Congress.  Now come the Republicans who are willing to extend Bush tax cuts to the wealthy without paying for them and to provide additional stimulus via payroll tax cuts, payments to low wage earners, extend unemployment benefits and college tuition assistance.  Seems to me Obama has come out very well on this.  And the Republicans will have to explain to their tea party faction why they chose this over deficit reduction.
Gag me with a spoon. Obama capitulated in just one day. He'd make a lousy lawyer.
I'm beginning to get a pretty darn good idea who I'm not voting for in 2012. And any New York State Democrat that's even considering voting for this better think twice.
Barack the Timid.  What a waste.  I'm completely disgusted by this latest sellout.

This is not change we can believe in. This is just same old politics. President Obama, you have let everybody, who believed in you, down with this meek surrender. Social security is already insolvent and we forgo even more social security taxes!!! If only low taxes spurred job & investments then we wouldn't even have this recession.

Although I voted for President Obam, he will NEVER receive my vote in the future. I state this not for the "deal" he cut with the republicans but becuase he has repeatedly shown that he is unable to stand firm nd argue effectively for his own convictions (if he has any).

As far as the "deal" made between the republicans and the Prewisdent, I think they have all shown that it is much more expedient to grow the deficit than it is to do the politically easy thing to garner future corporate good graces.
We are doomed as a nation finacially.The Chinese own more of us than we own. And it is going to get very bad for Americans in the future. Our financial house is in such disrepair that we have gone beyond the ability to redeem our finacial situation.

We need an Independent like Michale Bllomberg (fical conservative, social progressive) to run in 2012. It is our only hope.

Why are we even talking about this. We knew what would happen.
The GOP want it all their way.........and they are getting it from Mr. Compromise!

Where are the little folks involved in all of this?
Liar. Betrayer. There is no way to justify this. I've never been a Repub. Now I am not a Dem either.
So gopers are the biggest deficit spenders after all. We all knew boehner and mcconnell are not middle class. Now we know obama is too.
The GOP is playing Obama like a two dollar fiddle.

Can all this "pragmatism" somehow, in any way, be part of a greater plan by BO?  That thought is the only hope I have left for him, the Democratic (not "Democrat") Party, and the country.  But the thought seems more and more unlikely, and the hope more and more vapid.

In this lame Duck session of Congress the President had a choice to be a jive Turkey or a funky Chicken. I am disappointed that he has decided to eat crow. He has not let the chickens come home to roost over the 8 years of Bush policies that he ran his campaign against. So now it is evident , we voted against someone and not for someone.
He's a one and done Player President !
Pathetic, Obama. Pathetic. You are not a leader. Just a spineless democrat.
The new mantra: "NO, WE CAN'T"
President Obama - this is the best deal you could have made and I think it was the right one.
